name: Harvey Dent (Williams)
description: Harvey Dent, portrayed by Billy Dee Williams, is a district attorney in Gotham known for his strong stance against crime.

content.title: Background
content.body: Harvey Dent is the district attorney of Gotham City, dedicated to fighting crime and corruption. His commitment to the law and order in Gotham makes him a central character in the city's struggle against organized crime. Often working closely with Batman and Commissioner Gordon, Dent is a vital part of Gotham's justice system.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Harvey Dent is known for his unwavering determination and strong moral compass. He is highly principled, with a deep commitment to justice and the belief that the law can bring about meaningful change. However, his ideals sometimes lead him to take risks that can make him vulnerable.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: In the 1989 'Batman' film, Harvey Dent serves as a key figure in Gotham's legal system. Although his character did not become the infamous 'Two-Face' as in the comics, he played a foundational role in the fight against crime, setting the stage for his future duality in other adaptations.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
- **Bruce Wayne/Batman (Burton)**: A professional relationship where they both aim to rid Gotham of crime, with Batman working outside the law and Dent working within it.
- **Commissioner Gordon (Hingle)**: An ally in the fight against Gotham's criminals, often coordinating to bring justice to the city.
